values.description:
For teams that simply want to see whether their image is working on some reasonable version of a task there is no need for them to generate their own worlds from the yaml. This PR adds the worlds that they would produce if they were to use the given yaml files without modification \(which is likely what they will do\). This allows us to simplify testing instructions.

To test:

Follow the tutorial [here](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/Testing%20your%20submission) but skip step 2 under Verify your docker image is working.
values.title: adding some pre-generated task worlds to simplify basic testing

values.description: We are prohibiting this sensor but our example\_team is using it, so the example team will now fail the compliance check. This PR fixes that.
values.title: removing p3d sensor from example

summary.raw: We are prohibiting this sensor but our example\_team is using it, so the example team will now fail the compliance check. This PR fixes that.
summary.html: We are prohibiting this sensor but our example_team is using it, so the example team will now fail the compliance check. This PR fixes that.

values.description: Editing our dock.yaml files so they explicitly set enable\_color\_checker to False in generated trials, in hopes of reducing the probability that we accidentally do this. Also explicitly setting the task name to “scan” since it still defaults to dock in the xacro, but we are using “scan” to follow the documentation.
values.title: disable color checker in dock.yaml

summary.raw: Editing our dock.yaml files so they explicitly set enable\_color\_checker to False in generated trials, in hopes of reducing the probability that we accidentally do this. Also explicitly setting the task name to “scan” since it still defaults to dock in the xacro, but we are using “scan” to follow the documentation.
summary.html: Editing our dock.yaml files so they explicitly set enable_color_checker to False in generated trials, in hopes of reducing the probability that we accidentally do this. Also explicitly setting the task name to “scan” since it still defaults to dock in the xacro, but we are using “scan” to follow the documentation.
